rev.diff:
Line 93: Line 93:
===Volume bug===
===Volume bug===
â
In its review of 22 November 2011, [[Cnet|Cnet UK]] recommended that UK customers did not buy the phone yet because of a reported bug that "dropped the volume when we were using 2G. This means it was almost impossible to make calls over 2G. We missed calls and texts due to not hearing alerts. The bug caused the phone's volume to go haywire when we used a 2G network (we tested ours on Tesco Mobile, which uses O2's masts). This issue affected our unit to such a degree that making calls was almost impossible."<ref name=Cnetreview>{{cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review|url=http://reviews.cnet.co.uk/mobile-phones/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review-50005755/|publisher=Cnet (UK)|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>. This bug was reported by a number of users<ref name=Zbug>{{cite web|last=Woods|first=Ben|title=Samsung stays silent over Galaxy Nexus volume glitch|url=http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/samsung-stays-silent-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-glitch-10024853/|work=11-22-2011|publisher=Zdnet|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref><ref name=WPbug>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Galaxy Nexus hit with volume bug in Britain|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/technology/galaxy-nexus-hit-with-volume-bug-in-britain/2011/11/21/gIQAuLG2hN_story.html?tid=pm_business_pop|accessdate=22 November 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=11-22-2011}}</ref> and acknowledged by [[O2]] who noted that they were unable to offer a solution.<ref name=DSbug>{{cite web|last=Laughlin|first=Andrew|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus users report crippling volume bug|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tech/news/a352228/samsung-galaxy-nexus-users-report-crippling-volume-bug.html|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices. The company noted that "the tests are showing when in 2G mode the volume is acting erratically".<ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
+
In its review of 22 November 2011, [[Cnet|Cnet UK]] recommended that UK customers did not buy the phone yet because of a reported bug that "dropped the volume when we were using 2G. This means it was almost impossible to make calls over 2G. We missed calls and texts due to not hearing alerts. The bug caused the phone's volume to go haywire when we used a 2G network (we tested ours on Tesco Mobile, which uses O2's masts). This issue affected our unit to such a degree that making calls was almost impossible."<ref name=Cnetreview>{{cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review|url=http://reviews.cnet.co.uk/mobile-phones/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review-50005755/|publisher=Cnet (UK)|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>. This bug was reported by a number of users<ref name=Zbug>{{cite web|last=Woods|first=Ben|title=Samsung stays silent over Galaxy Nexus volume glitch|url=http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/samsung-stays-silent-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-glitch-10024853/|work=11-22-2011|publisher=Zdnet|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref><ref name=WPbug>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Galaxy Nexus hit with volume bug in Britain|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/technology/galaxy-nexus-hit-with-volume-bug-in-britain/2011/11/21/gIQAuLG2hN_story.html?tid=pm_business_pop|accessdate=22 November 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=11-22-2011}}</ref> and acknowledged by [[O2]] who noted that they were unable to offer a solution.<ref name=DSbug>{{cite web|last=Laughlin|first=Andrew|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus users report crippling volume bug|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tech/news/a352228/samsung-galaxy-nexus-users-report-crippling-volume-bug.html|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices. The company noted that "the tests are showing when in 2G mode the volume is acting erratically".<ref>http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
